Description: Lower body sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) Wild Goat Style pottery bowl; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with added white and added red bands; exterior: part of three vertical strokes as filling ornament; below, narrow and wide brown bands above tip of ray; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1965,0930.207 and 1888,0601.183.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.090)
